caption_original: Today we’re celebrating years of bird conservation! In , the United States and Canada signed the Migratory Birds Convention- a pledge to protect Migratory Birds. In , the Migratory Birds Convention Act was hatched and it became law! Since then, nearly birds have been protected and studied, to help sustain biodiversity, and to further understanding of the health of our environment....

caption_original: ...C3 Fauna: Did you know the Arctic is home to thousands of seabirds, who divide their time between the ocean, and steep rocky cliffs? We were lucky enough to see thick billed murres up close yesterday. Murres can dive over meters deep in search of food and will fly to miles away from the island on their foraging flights.
